title: Who was Jay’s dad Jase in EastEnders and how did he die?
text:
Jay is in for a nasty blast from the past (Picture: BBC/Kieron McCarron)

Jay Brown (Jamie Borthwick) is due to get a nasty shock in upcoming EastEnders scenes.

Terry Bates, a local criminal who was responsible for the death of his father Jase, is going to be Jay’s next client at the funeral home.

When an elaborate and expensive funeral is demanded for the dead gangster, Jay will have to relive the grief he felt when his father was first taken from him…

Who was Jay’s dad Jase in EastEnders?

Jase Dyer (Stephen Lord) featured on EastEnders from 2007 until 2008.

He first came to Walford all those years ago to find Jay, from whom he was then estranged.

Jase had known Terry since he was a teenager, and despite initially refusing to do so on his arrival in Walford, Jase ended up working for the mobster to ease his fiancee Dawn’s (Kara Tointon) financial worries and keep her happy.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Jase’s relationship with Terry soured however when he got into debt with Terry’s gang.

During a horrifying final showdown, young Jay had to hide in another room and listen as his father was beaten and stabbed to death.

Terry ended up sentenced to life in prison for the crime.

Tonight, Jay will learn that he must lay the man responsible for his father’s cruel death to rest.

Unsurprisingly, Jay will find it hard to stomach the thought of helping the gangster’s loved ones celebrate his life.

When he agrees to take the job, it soon becomes clear that Jay has a plan.

With a recent trailer showing Jay turning to booze and standing over Terry’s body, promising to reveal the horrible truth about the kind of man he was, could Jay be inviting danger to his door, just like his father before him?

EastEnders continues on Tuesday 22nd October at 7:30pm on BBC One.

MORE: Tameka Empson confirms EastEnders return for Kim Fox-Hubbard with a ‘Christmas cracker’ of a storyline

description: Jay is in for a nasty blast from the past on EastEnders when he discovers that his latest funeral client was involved in his dad's death...
